page.title: 20Farming Near Fakenham
page.content: Farming in this area is mostly arable, though there is also dairy and beef farming and a few sheep. The land is fairly flat so fields can be large to allow for the use of large machines. This has also led to the destruction of many hedges, which has in its turn led to soil erosion, the eradication of wildlife habitat and loss of natural beauty. The main crops are cereal, sugar beet and oil seed rape. Pensthorpe is a soft fruit farm (strawberries, raspberries and gooseberries), and the owner is creating a wild fowl reserve which will soon be open to the public. The farming creates a few full time jobs and some seasonal work, plus work in the related industries. {CREDITS}Class 1 (6-7 yr olds), parents staff and friends of Fakenham Infant School.
